taskDescription:
Albertâ€™s Honda Civic gets 37 miles per gallon of gasoline. The gas tank on the Civic can hold <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>13.5</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">13.5</annotation></semantics></math> gallons of gas. Albert is driving from Tucson, Arizona to Los Angeles, California, a distance of 485 miles. Albert thinks he can make it on one full tank of gasoline. Can he? Explain.
detailedSolution:
Yes he can, but barely. At 37 miles per gallon, Albert can drive <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mn>499.5</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">499.5</annotation></semantics></math> miles. While in theory he can make it, he probably should fill up with gasoline somewhere along the way!
